item.title: Litter & Bins Issue, 16th October
item.description:
Again, I'm not sure if Bromley Council control this little alley area 'The Mews', but the bins situation here is ridiculous with wheelie bins strewn around, left open, overflowing, foxes spilling litter out into the street at night, and some wheelie bins looking like they need replacing badly. I'm quite sure all these bins have a special housing area around the back out of sight because if you look on Google maps, going back a few years, none of these bins/Eurobins were here.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): The Mews, Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pavement obstruction, 16th October
item.description:
The pavement is obstructed by loads of rubbish bins with rubbish quite often all over the floor and indeed I slipped on plastic packaging in the wet resulting in a strained groin muscle and a month of being housebound due to Hardy being able to walk without the aid of crutches due to the pain I realise this isn't Bromley Council fault I'm not trying to Sue anyone or claim compensation I just want the matter sorted

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Plaistow Lane, Plaistow, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter Issue, 16th October
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ella Close, Beckenham, London

item.title: Tarmac needed to fill large holes on Friary Road, 16th October

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 121, Friary Road, Peckham, London

item.title: Speed Bump, 16th October
item.description:
Dear Highways Team - A recently installed speed bump at the intersection of Steele's Road and Haverstock Hill has been installed in such a way it is damaging cars. Any car going over this speed bump scrapes the underside of the car at any speed. Please see that it is adjusted or costs of damage will be passed on to Camden Council and their sub-contractors who installed this speed bump.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 22, Steele's Road, Chalk Farm, London
Report on FixMyStreet
